noun.description: Linguistics. The changing of another sound, especially the phoneme/s/, into the phoneme/r/, and thus often also the changing of the spelling.
Unusual pronunciation or pronounced production of the phoneme/r/ as a phonological characteristic or speech defect; specifically the use of the burr or uvular r.

origin: Mid 19th century. From German Rhotacismus from Byzantine Greek ῥωτακίζειν + German -ismus.
